author: diariopopular
title: Los Murci√©lagos vencieron a Brasil y son finalistas en Par√≠s
text:
En la definici√≥n por penales el equipo albiceleste se impuso 4-3 tras igualar sin goles en el tiempo reglamentario.
La Selecci√≥n Argentina de f√∫tbol para ciegos, Los Murci√©lagos, consigui√≥ el pase a la final de los Juegos paral√≠mpicos de Par√≠s 2024 luego de ganarle a Brasil en definici√≥in por penales por 4-3 tras empatar 0-0 a lo largo del tiempo regular.
Los Murci√©lagos enfrentar√°n en la final a Francia, que le gan√≥ a Colombia por 1-0, el d√≠a s√°bado, en b√∫squeda de su primera medalla dorada en Juegos Paral√≠mpicos.
Dos medallas m√°s para la delegaci√≥n argentina La delegaci√≥n argentina sum√≥ dos nuevas medallas en los Juegos Paral√≠mpicos de Par√≠s 2024, luego de que Paula G√≥mez (judo) y Stefan√≠a Ferrando y Rodrigo Romero (boccia) consiguieran el tercer lugar en sus respectivas disciplinas.
Los primeros medallistas del d√≠a para la Argentina fueron Ferrando y Romero, quienes consiguieron la de bronce en boccia mixto tras superar por 4-2 en el encuentro por el tercer puesto a los tailandeses Akkadej Choochuenklin y Ladamanee Kla-Han.
Es la primera vez que la Argentina obtiene una medalla en esta disciplina.
Luego fue el turno de la judoca G√≥mez, que le gan√≥ a la canadiense Priscila Gagne y se qued√≥ tambi√©n con la medalla de bronce en la categor√≠a -57 kilogramos.
De esta manera, la delegaci√≥n argentina alcanz√≥ las nueve medallas en los actuales Juegos Paral√≠mpicos, igualando la cantidad obtenida en Tokio 2021 (aunque en la capital japonesa no cosecharon ning√∫n oro).
El que no pudo llegar a la final fue el tenista Gustavo Fern√°ndez, quien cay√≥ ante el japon√©s Tokito Oda por 6-2 y 7-5 y jugar√° por el bronce.
Videos relacionados: Aparecen en esta nota: Los Murci√©lagos Juegos Paral√≠mpicos

author: Dr. Partha Nandi
title: How overindulging during the holiday season can trigger heart issues
text:
(WXYZ) ‚Äî Eating and drinking are a big part of holiday celebrations. But for some, overindulging can trigger a condition called holiday heart syndrome.
By the sound of it, you might think "holiday heart" means a heart full of joy. But it's actually the opposite. Holiday heart can happen when too much alcohol, salty foods and sweets put stress on your heart. This can cause your heart to beat irregularly, which we in the medical field call atrial fibrillation, or AFib. AFib happens when the electrical signals in the heart's upper chambers don‚Äôt work properly, causing a fast, pounding heartbeat.
The reason it's called holiday heart syndrome is that we see a lot of cases this time of year when people are enjoying festive foods and cocktails.
Now, who's most at risk? People with existing heart issues are definitely at higher risk. However, holiday heart syndrome can happen to anyone. In the short term, it can be a worrisome side effect of overindulging. But over time, it may lead to more dangerous conditions like heart failure or stroke.
For some folks, they may feel like their heart is racing out of control. Others might notice irregular beats. Other common symptoms include:
- Chest discomfort, pain or pressure
- Dizziness or lightheadedness
- Shortness of breath
- Feeling overly tired or drained of energy
If you notice any of these, please stop drinking alcohol right away. Most of the time, holiday heart syndrome clears up on its own. But if the symptoms stick around, or you get unusually winded walking on flat ground, these are red flags. It's best to head to the emergency room to get checked out.
Now, I would recommend that folks avoid holiday heart syndrome, and here are some tips:
- Watch your alcohol: avoid drinking too much or binge drinking
- Eat Smart: fill up on healthy options first and go easy on salty or fatty foods
- Manage Stress: it can take a toll on your heart, so find ways to relax
- Know Your Limits: If you have a history of heart issues, talk to your doctor about what is safe for you
Also, be cautious with medications like NSAIDs, or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs. While they can help with hangover symptoms, they might raise your blood pressure and increase your risk of heart issues.
The holidays are a time to celebrate, but keeping things in moderation will help you enjoy them safely.
THIS WEEK ON 'THE DR. NANDI SHOW'
Curious about boosting emotional health? Dr. Partha Nandi, MD, delves into the Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT), commonly known as ‚ÄúTapping,‚Äù to show how this powerful practice can help release negative emotions and enhance well-being. Nick Ortner, New York Times bestselling author and CEO of The Tapping Solution, shares his experiences and valuable advice on using this simple, effective, natural healing method. Also, EFT Practitioner Julie Booksh presents a tapping demo, so you can try this transformative technique yourself. Tune in this Sunday, Dec. 22 at 2 p.m.

author: Jim Biros
title: Big Man on Campus: At 6-foot-9, Rocco Paulson stands out on the hardwood and in the classroom
text:
It‚Äôs not difficult to spot Rocco Paulson on the University of Wisconsin-Superior campus. Whether he‚Äôs in Swenson Hall between classes, the Yellowjacket Union during the lunchtime rush or in Mertz Mortorelli Gymnasium as a member of the Yellowjackets men‚Äôs basketball team , finding the 6-foot-9 Paulson is easy.
A sophomore at UW-Superior, Paulson is carrying out his basketball dreams thanks to an early introduction by his parents, both of whom are coaches with record-breaking collegiate careers.
‚ÄúI went to my first basketball practice when I was four weeks old,‚Äù Paulson said. ‚ÄúMy dad was holding me. I‚Äôve been dribbling a ball since I was able to walk. So, basketball has always kind of been there.‚Äù
Growing up in Duluth, Paulson often found himself at UW-Superior for summer league games. His connection with the campus deepened during his senior year when head men‚Äôs basketball coach Greg Polkowski reached out.
‚ÄúI started coming over to UWS to check out the college side of things,‚Äù said Paulson. ‚ÄúI began checking out more of the campus and seeing what attending and pursuing college basketball would be like. In high school, I started taking basketball a more seriously, and that‚Äôs when Coach Polkowski reached out to me and then offered me the ability to continue that path.‚Äù
While basketball played a major role in bringing Paulson to UW-Superior, it‚Äôs what he learned about the university outside of the Marcovich Wellness Center that truly made campus feel like home.
‚ÄúA lot of my friends went to much larger universities and at first I thought I want to follow them, so I could still be with my friends,‚Äù said Paulson. ‚ÄúBut the classes are huge there and you‚Äôre walking everywhere. Snow gets annoying when you‚Äôve got to walk 20 or 40 minutes to class. The small class sizes of UWS creates closer community. It really was a big draw for me.‚Äù
The class sizes have also helped Paulson connect with his professors.
‚ÄúI‚Äôll say hi to my professors whenever I see them in the hallways,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nice that you‚Äôre not nervous to raise your hand. You kind of know everyone in your class. I‚Äôve always appreciated that you can make more friends that way.‚Äù
Making friends hasn‚Äôt been difficult for Paulson. He‚Äôs currently a member of the Student Athlete Advisory Committee (SAAG) and will become co-president of the organization next year. He‚Äôs also served as president of the UWS Changemakers student organization.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve been able to be a part of a lot of clubs and go to a lot of activities,‚Äù he said.
At UW-Superior, Paulson can follow another passion ignited by his parents.
‚ÄúI want to be a teacher,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúMy mom‚Äôs a teacher and my dad works at a community college. I‚Äôve always been surrounded by academics. And, I work as a teacher right now of sorts.‚Äù
Paulson, who was named to the Upper Midwest Athletic Conference (UMAC) Academic All-Conference in his freshman year, has already gained experience in the field at Stella Maris Academy ‚Äì working at a summer program for third to sixth grade students assisting with an extended care program for preschool to sixth grade students during the school year.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a blessing,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really awesome to get that experience so early. It‚Äôs just great to be able to go to school, get your education, play a sport you love and do the job you want to do in the future ‚Äì all in a week.‚Äù

author: @le_parisien
title: Gr√¢ce √† Ariane 6, des √©tudiants montpelli√©rains vont pouvoir pr√©dire les √©pisodes c√©venols
text:
Gr√¢ce √† Ariane 6, des √©tudiants montpelli√©rains vont pouvoir pr√©dire les √©pisodes c√©venols
Le petit satellite Robusta A3 a √©t√© mis en orbite la semaine derni√®re par la toute nouvelle fus√©e europ√©enne. Il a donn√© signe de vie, un soulagement pour les √©quipes qui ont travaill√© sur ce projet.
D‚Äôune longueur de 30 centim√®tres, le parall√©l√©pip√®de est de dimension encore plus modeste qu‚Äôune bo√Æte √† chaussures. Petit, donc. Mais costaud.
Depuis la semaine derni√®re, le bien nomm√© Robusta 3A tourne autour de la Terre et, pour le plus grand plaisir des nombreuses personnes qui ont particip√© √† son d√©veloppement, ce nanosatellite a rapidement donn√© signe de vie. ¬´ Robusta 3A va bien, tr√®s bien ¬ª, a confirm√© jeudi 18 juillet Laurent Dusseau, directeur du Centre spatial universitaire de Montpellier (CSUM), qui m√®ne ce projet depuis plus de dix ans.
Depuis l‚Äôespace, ce satellite aura pour mission d‚Äôobserver la Terre et d‚Äôanticiper les √©pisodes c√©venols, des ph√©nom√®nes m√©t√©orologiques violents qui touchent r√©guli√®rement le sud-est de la France. ¬´ Diff√©rentes g√©n√©rations d‚Äô√©tudiants ¬ª se sont succ√©d√© pour le mettre au point, fait remarquer Philippe Aug√©, pr√©sident de l‚Äôuniversit√© de Montpellier, l‚Äôune des premi√®res du monde sur les questions environnementales selon le r√©put√© classement de Shanghai.

author: ABNewswire
title: Infectious Disease Diagnostics Market Worth $31.5 Billion |
text:
Infectious Disease Diagnostics Market Worth $31.5 Billion | MarketsandMarkets 10-18-2024 12:00 AM CET | Health & Medicine
Press release from: ABNewswire The infectious disease diagnostics market is segmented into reagents, kits, and consumables; instruments; and software & services based on product & service. The reagents, kits, and consumables segment dominated the infectious disease diagnostics market
Infectious Disease Diagnostics Market in terms of revenue was estimated to be worth $21.4 billion in 2023 and is poised to reach $31.5 billion by 2028, growing at a CAGR of 8.0% from 2023 to 2028 according to a new report by MarketsandMarkets Trademark
Infectious Disease Diagnostics Market [ https://www.marketsandmarkets.com/Market-Reports/infectious-disease-diagnostics-market-116764589.html?utm_source=abnewswire.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=paidpr ] in terms of revenue was estimated to be worth $21.4 billion in 2023 and is poised to reach $31.5 billion by 2028, growing at a CAGR of 8.0% from 2023 to 2028 according to a new report by MarketsandMarkets Trademark . Market growth is largely driven by the rising prevalence of infectious diseases and the increasing funding for R&D in disease diagnostics. The rising incidence of infectious diseases worldwide creates a substantial demand for effective diagnostic tools. As the global healthcare landscape grapples with the challenges posed by infectious agents, there is a heightened emphasis on developing advanced diagnostic technologies to enable timely and accurate detection.
Download an Illustrative overview: https://www.marketsandmarkets.com/pdfdownloadNew.asp?id=116764589 [ https://www.marketsandmarkets.com/pdfdownloadNew.asp?id=116764589&utm_source=abnewswire.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=paidpr ]
In 2022, the reagents, kits, and consumables segment held the largest share of the infectious disease diagnostics market by product & service segment.
The infectious disease diagnostics market is segmented into reagents, kits, and consumables; instruments; and software & services based on product & service. The reagents, kits, and consumables segment dominated the infectious disease diagnostics market in 2022. The requirement of reagents, kits, and consumables in large numbers compared to instruments is the main factor contributing to the large share of this segment. Unlike instruments, reagents, kits, and consumables require repeat purchases, which results in stable demand among end users.
The blood, serum, and plasma segment held the largest share of the infectious disease diagnostics market by sample type segment in 2022.
Based on sample type, the infectious disease diagnostics market has been segmented into blood, serum, and plasma, urine, and other sample types. In 2022, the blood, serum, and plasma segment accounted for the largest share of the infectious disease diagnostics market, by sample type. These sample types provide a rich and diverse pool of infectious disease diagnostic information. They contain circulating DNA, RNA, proteins, and other biomarkers that carry valuable insights into various diseases and conditions. This wealth of information enables healthcare professionals to make accurate diagnoses, monitor disease progression, and personalize treatment decisions.
North America is the largest regional market for infectious disease diagnostics market.
The market for infectious disease diagnostics has been divided into five key geographical regions: North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Latin America, and the Middle East & Africa. In 2022, North America held the predominant portion of the infectious disease diagnostics market. The infectious disease diagnostics market in North America is well-established, with the US being a major market in this region. This dominance can be attributed to various factors, including advanced healthcare infrastructure, a high prevalence of infectious diseases, and significant investments in diagnostic technologies.

author: SBT
title: Congresso pede suspens√£o da decis√£o de Dino que interrompeu uso de emendas
text: Congresso pede suspens√£o da decis√£o de Dino que interrompeu uso de emendas Na C√¢mara, l√≠deres discutem alternativas para garantir transpar√™ncia no encaminhamento de recursos e fazem movimento contra Judici√°rio A C√¢mara dos Deputados, o Senado e partidos entraram com um pedido de suspens√£o da decis√£o do ministro Fl√°vio Dino, do Supremo Tribunal Federal (STF) em interromper o uso de emendas impositivas no Congresso Nacional. A posi√ß√£o foi oficializada nesta quinta-feira (15), e cita todas decis√µes individuais de Dino relacionadas ao envio de recursos por parlamentares. [+ C√¢mara adia vota√ß√£o da reforma tribut√°ria em meio √†s negocia√ß√µes por emendas](https://sbtnews.sbt.com.br/noticia/politica/camara-adia-votacao-da-reforma-tributaria-em-meio-as-negociacoes-por-emendas) O pedido est√° atrelado a cr√≠ticas de parlamentares √† posi√ß√£o do magistrado, com questionamentos √† pausa do processo. Por meio de nota, a C√¢mara afirma que n√£o havia urg√™ncia para as posi√ß√µes de Dino. ‚ÄúAs decis√µes monocr√°ticas, proferidas fora de qualquer contexto de urg√™ncia que justificasse uma an√°lise isolada, e n√£o colegiada, transcenderam em muito o debate em torno de alegada falta de transpar√™ncia das denominadas ‚Äòemendas PIX‚Äô‚Äù, diz trecho do comunicado. [+ Dino suspende emendas impositivas at√© Congresso criar novas regras de transpar√™ncia](https://sbtnews.sbt.com.br/noticia/politica/dino-suspende-emendas-impositivas-ate-congresso-criar-novas-regras-de-transparencia) Deputados ainda questionam a posi√ß√£o ao apontar que, em uma decis√£o individual, o STF desconstitui processos que estavam em vigor h√° quase dez anos e foram aprovadas em tr√™s diferentes presid√™ncias da C√¢mara. ‚ÄúNo entendimento das Advocacias da C√¢mara dos Deputados e do Senado e dos Partidos Pol√≠ticos, as decis√µes causam danos irrepar√°veis √† economia p√∫blica, √† sa√∫de, √† seguran√ßa e √† pr√≥pria ordem jur√≠dica, al√©m de violar patentemente a separa√ß√£o de poderes‚Äù, destaca outro trecho da nota. As cr√≠ticas foram assinadas por onze partidos de diferentes frentes pol√≠ticas e, inicialmente, n√£o contou com apoio do PT, mas o partido endossou o documento horas ap√≥s a divulga√ß√£o. As siglas que apoiaram a posi√ß√£o foram: PL, Uni√£o Brasil, PP, PSD, PSB, Republicanos, PSDB, PDT, Solidariedade, MDB e, agora, PT. Resposta ao Judici√°rio Em resposta ao Supremo, a Comiss√£o Mista de Or√ßamento (CMO) rejeitou na quarta-feira (14) uma medida provis√≥ria que direcionava R$ 1,3 bilh√£o para recompor o Or√ßamento do Judici√°rio. A vota√ß√£o veio de maneira simb√≥lica, sem contagem de votos. A medida ainda ser√° analisada pelo plen√°rio da C√¢mara, nesta quinta-feira (15).

author: Shannon Brown
title: Met Office issues thunderstorm warning for parts of UK as heatwave ends - Plymouth Live
text: The sunny weather much of the UK has been enjoying is due to come to an abrupt end as the Met Office issues a thunderstorm warning across parts of the country. The severe weather alert lasting from midday until 10pm on Sunday, May 12, predicts lighting storms, heavy rainfall, and potential flooding across parts of the UK. Plymouth is just outside of the warning zone, with the yellow weather warning covering much of the South Hams , narrowly missing Ivybridge . Read more: The weather forecasters, based in Exeter, are predicting that up to 50mm of rain could fall in just two hours this Sunday, despite temperatures remaining around a pleasantly warm 23C, reports BristolLive . A spokesperson for the Met Office warns: "Heavy showers and thunderstorms could lead to some disruption in places, especially to travel. Isolated property flooding is possible. "Heavy showers and thunderstorms are likely to break out in the south of this area late Sunday morning and early Sunday afternoon, moving steadily north while growing into larger areas of rain before clearing the area. "Some intense downpours are possible in a few places, giving up to 30 mm in less than hour and perhaps 40-50 mm over two to three hours leading to surface water flooding. Hail, frequent lightning strikes and strong wind gusts will be additional localised hazards." The warning encompasses vast areas of the west, including Bristol, Somerset, Devon and Gloucestershire, as well as most of Wales. Despite the impending heavy rain and storms, temperatures are predicted to stay high. Plymouth is set to see temperatures of 20c on Friday, 21C on Saturday and 18C on Sunday. Heavy downpours are predicted for Monday, with temperatures of 14C.

author: @httweets
title: George Clooney needs to 'put Amal first' before politics to save this marriage: Report
text:
George Clooney needs to ‚Äòput Amal first‚Äô before politics to save this marriage: Report
Amal Clooney is contemplating a return to Europe amid marital strain with George, whose political missteps have reportedly tested their relationship.
George and Amal Clooney's marriage is said to be ‚Äúat a crossroads‚Äù, with Amal reportedly considering returning to Europe and leaving George in New York. But why so?
The Oscar-winning actor's Broadway debut in Good Night, and Good Luck took the stage at New York‚Äôs Winter Garden Theatre to strong reviews and record-breaking ticket sales. But while Hollywood stars filled the audience on opening night, one notable absence cast a shadow over the celebration: Amal Clooney, his wife of ten years.
George told reporters she was home ‚Äúwith the kids,‚Äù 7-year-old twins Alexander and Ella. But insiders told Radar Online, ‚ÄúCertainly, they have options when it comes to childcare so that Amal could get away for a couple of hours.‚Äù
ALSO READ| How Donald Trump could bar George Clooney's wife, Amal, from entering the US under this new sanction
‚ÄúPeople were whispering, wondering whether there might be trouble in the marriage.‚Äù
Those close to him say George ‚Äúrespects and loves Amal,‚Äù and added, he just ‚Äúneeds to rearrange his priorities and put his wife and family first.‚Äù
Whispers of divorce for George and Amal Clooney making headlines
While the couple has long been admired, their relationship appears to be facing strain, and George‚Äôs recent political stances haven‚Äôt helped.
Just in July, Clooney sparked backlash by penning a New York Times op-ed urging then-President Joe Biden to step down from the 2024 race. The controversy intensified when, according to a new book, Uncharted, George went ‚Äúballistic‚Äù after an MSNBC segment implied former President Barack Obama was behind the piece.
Later, the veteran Batman star‚Äôs public support for Kamala Harris also fizzled. ‚ÄúHe had to face the fact that his ‚Äòopinion doesn't carry as much weight as he thought,‚Äô‚Äù the report stated, noting that Amal was ‚Äúrunning out of patience with her husband's political missteps.‚Äù
ALSO READ| Megyn Kelly fires back at George Clooney over journalism jab: ‚ÄòThat‚Äôs not journalism, George‚Ä¶‚Äô
Amal, named 2024‚Äôs International Lawyer of the Year by Legal 500, has reportedly struggled with being sidelined during George‚Äôs Broadway run. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs willing to support George, but not if it means her career comes second,‚Äù a source told Radar Online.
‚ÄúIt has put George in a bad mood. He can be unbearable to be around sometimes,‚Äù added the insider.

author: @eluniversal
title: "Aprendimos eso con No√©": hombre desaf√≠a el hurac√°n Milton en su velero y sale ileso (+Videos)
text: "Aprendimos eso con No√©": hombre desaf√≠a el hurac√°n Milton en su velero y sale ileso (+Videos) "El lugar m√°s seguro para estar en caso de inundaci√≥n es en un barco", argument√≥ un residente de Florida, conocido por su apodo como 'teniente Dan' El hombre, que perdi√≥ una de sus piernas hace a√±os, y es conocido por el apodo 'teniente Dan', se hizo viral por negarse a abandonar su vivienda en el barco, hasta tal punto, que la Polic√≠a de Tampa tuvo que intervenir para convencerlo. La alcaldesa de Tampa, Jane Castor, afirm√≥ durante una rueda de prensa la ma√±ana de mi√©rcoles que los uniformados lograron "rescatar" al hombre. "Si logramos que el 'teniente Dan' fuera a un refugio, podemos lograr que cualquiera lo haga", declar√≥ durante una rueda de prensa la tarde de mi√©rcoles. No obstante, result√≥ que Malinowski permaneci√≥ en su bote. El hecho fue confirmado por el corresponsal de NewsNation, Brian Entin, quien lo fotografi√≥ poco despu√©s de la rueda de prensa de la alcaldesa. I know the Mayor of Tampa just said in her press conference that Lieutenant Dan went to a shelter. ‚Äî Brian Entin (@BrianEntin) He didn‚Äôt, I‚Äôm standing right here.[https://t.co/Wv6NleShNW][pic.twitter.com/40c7aLqI9B][October 9, 2024] Just went over to check on Lieutenant Dan during a break in the weather - he just cut one of his lines because he said his boat was hitting the wall but he‚Äôs ok. ‚Äî Brian Entin (@BrianEntin)[pic.twitter.com/ud99i3akbF][October 9, 2024] Hang in there, Lieutenant Dan! Defeat Hurricane Milton, or Mike Tyson will. ‚Äî parachutesBTC (@parachutesBTC)[pic.twitter.com/LDCQAiW9ma][October 10, 2024] Lieutenant Dan is okay! ‚Äî Brian Entin (@BrianEntin)[pic.twitter.com/0uthxRigRT][October 10, 2024] "Aprendimos eso con No√©. Todos los que se quedaron en tierra se ahogaron. Si sube la marea, yo subo. Mientras el agua no entre en el barco, estar√© bien", recoge sus palabras New York Post. Lieutenant Dan CONFIRMED ALIVE and SURVIVED! üôè‚ù§Ô∏è ‚Äî DramaAlert (@DramaAlert)[pic.twitter.com/5EejHtbgkw][October 10, 2024] [Telegram](https://t.me/ElUniversalVzla),
